Package camzup.core

Class PngParser

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.PngParser
public abstract class PngParser
extends java.lang.Object
An incomplete draft of a portable network graphics parser. Even if this is completed, it will not be robust or tolerant of faulty data. Use only for creative applications where you know the source of the image.

Made with reference to Casey Muratori's Handmade Hero tutorials.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  PngParser.Chunk
    Defines a chunk of portable network graphics (.png) information.
    static class  PngParser.ColorFormat
    Describes possible color formats supported by the .png file format: 0 (grey scale with alpha), 2 (red green and blue), 3 (indexed), 4 (gray scale) and 6 (red green and blue with alpha).
    static class  PngParser.IDATChunk
    Defines a chunk of portable network graphics (.png) information.
    static class  PngParser.IHDRChunk
    Defines a header chunk for portable network graphics (.png) information.
    static class  PngParser.PHYSChunk
    Defines a physical dimensions chunk for portable network graphics (.png) information.

    A critical chunk signature describing the data of a .png file.

    A critical chunk signature describing the end of the .png file.

  • Method Details

    • parsePng

      public static Img parsePng​(java.lang.String filePath, Img target)

    • parsePngToChunks

      public static PngParser.Chunk[] parsePngToChunks​(java.lang.String filepath)
      Given a file path, loads a .png file as bytes then parses them into chunks according to the .png file format specification.
      Parameters:
      filepath - the file path
      Returns:
      the chunks array

    • sigIdatBytes

      public static byte[] sigIdatBytes()
      A critical chunk signature describing the data of a .png file. In decimal format: 
       { 73, 68, 65, 84 }
      In hexadecimal format: 
       
 { 0x31, 0x2c, 0x29, 0x36 }
      When the bytes are cast to characters, they spell out the signature, i.e., 'I', 'D', 'A', 'T'.
      Returns:
      the byte array

    • sigIEndBytes

      public static byte[] sigIEndBytes()
      A critical chunk signature describing the end of the .png file. In decimal format: 
       { 73, 69, 78, 68 }
      In hexadecimal format: 
       
 { 0x49, 0x45, 0x4e, 0x44 }
      When the bytes are cast to characters, they spell out the signature, i.e., 'I', 'E', 'N', 'D'.
      Returns:
      the byte array

    • sigIhdrBytes

      public static byte[] sigIhdrBytes()
      A critical chunk signature describing the file's width, height, bit depth, color type, compression method, filter method and interlace method. In decimal format: 
       { 73, 72, 68, 82 }
      In hexadecimal format: 
       { 0x49, 0x48, 0x44, 0x52 }
      When the bytes are cast to characters, they spell out the signature, i.e., 'I', 'H', 'D', 'R'.
      Returns:
      the byte array

    • sigPhysBytes

      public static byte[] sigPhysBytes()
      An ancillary chunk signature describing intended pixel size or aspect ratio for display of a .png file. In decimal format: 
       { 112, 72, 89, 115 }
      In hexadecimal format: 
       
 { 0x70, 0x48, 0x59, 0x73 }
      When the bytes are cast to characters, they spell out the signature, i.e., 'p', 'H', 'Y', 's'.
      Returns:
      the byte array

    • sigPlteBytes

      public static byte[] sigPlteBytes()
      A critical chunk signature describing the data of an indexed .png file. In decimal format: 
       { 80, 76, 84, 69 }
      In hexadecimal format: 
       { 0x50, 0x4c, 0x54, 0x45 }
      When the bytes are cast to characters, they spell out the signature, i.e., 'P', 'L', 'T', 'E'.
      Returns:
      the byte array

    • sigPng

      public static byte[] sigPng()
      The signature, in 8 bytes, for the .png (portable network graphics) file format. In decimal format: 
       { 137, 80, 78, 71, 13, 10, 26, 10 }
      In hexadecimal format: 
       { 0x89, 0x50, 0x4e, 0x47, 0x0d, 0x0a, 0x1a, 0x0a }
      Because Java bytes are signed, and 137 exceeds Byte.MAX_VALUE (127), it wraps around to -119.
      Returns:
      the byte array

    • sigTimeBytes

      public static byte[] sigTimeBytes()
      An ancillary chunk signature describing the last time the file was modified. In decimal format: 
       { 116, 73, 77, 69 }
      In hexadecimal format: 
       { 0x74, 0x49, 0x4d, 0x45 }
      When the bytes are cast to characters, they spell out the signature, i.e., 't', 'I', 'M', 'E'.
      Returns:
      the byte array
